meanings.definition: A situation in which no progress is possible, especially because of disagreement; a deadlock.
meanings.sent1: The team reached an impasse during the meeting and couldn't agree on a solution.
meanings.sent2: The negotiations came to an impasse, and both parties refused to compromise.
meanings.sent3: At the impasse, they decided to settle the argument with a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The impasse between the two countries was like a giant wall blocking any further discussions.
meanings.sent5: The impasse in the debate was like a giant boulder in the middle of the road, impossible to move.

meanings.definition: A point at which a road or passage is blocked; a cul-de-sac.
meanings.sent1: The dead-end street led to an impasse, forcing the driver to turn around.
meanings.sent2: The hikers encountered an impasse where the trail was completely blocked by fallen trees.
meanings.sent3: The impasse in the road made the delivery truck take a long detour.
meanings.sent4: The impasse in the tunnel felt like a trap, with no way to escape.
meanings.sent5: The impasse in the maze was the final challenge before reaching the exit.
